headline: 3 people injured following stabbing at Hamilton mosque, police say | CBC News
context: Police are looking for two suspects after receiving reports that several people had been stabbed at a downtown Hamilton mosque.

annotations.reason: This is a byline and does not contribute to the story.

annotations.paragraph: Three people are injured following stabbing at a downtown mosque in Hamilton, police say.
annotations.reason: This provides a summary of the incident, directly related to the headline.

annotations.paragraph: Hamilton police said they received reports at 2:15 p.m. that several people had been stabbed "after an altercation" that started outside the mosque on York Boulevard and then continued inside the building.
annotations.reason: This gives specific details about the timing and location of the incident.

annotations.paragraph: The incident, police said, is not believed to be hate-motivated at this time and the people involved "were known to each other."
annotations.reason: This provides important context about the nature of the incident.

annotations.paragraph: One person was transported to hospital, police said, with non-life-threatening injuries, and another was treated at the scene. A third person showed up at the hospital, police said, with non-life-threatening injuries.
annotations.reason: This gives details about the injuries and medical response, relevant to the incident.

annotations.paragraph: Police are now looking for two suspects who fled in an "unknown direction."
annotations.reason: This provides new information about the suspects' escape.

annotations.paragraph: "There are conflicting reports whether it was one or two separate vehicles," police said.
annotations.reason: This adds details about the uncertainty regarding the suspects' getaway vehicles.

annotations.paragraph: MP-elect for Hamilton Centre Aslam Rana was at the mosque late afternoon. He said he heard what happened and went to the scene, where he was able to speak with police.
annotations.reason: This provides context about a local official's involvement and response.

annotations.paragraph: He said he was told there was a prayer service at the mosque around 2 p.m. "There was a big gathering in here and this thing all happened near the shoe area," he said.
annotations.reason: This gives context about the timing and location of the incident within the mosque.

annotations.paragraph: Rana had not spoken directly with the mosque's leadership, he added.
annotations.reason: This does not add significant information to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: "These prayer places should be safe and sound ... everybody should pray safely and go home safely," he told CBC Hamilton.
annotations.reason: The quote is a general statement about safety in prayer places and does not provide new information about the incident.
